H0.text: According to the late Dr Robert Atkins, what kind of nutrient will 'make you fat'. Fats

H1.text: According to the late Dr Robert Atkins, what kind of nutrient will 'make you fat'. Proteins

H2.text: According to the late Dr Robert Atkins, what kind of nutrient will 'make you fat'. Fiber

H3.text: According to the late Dr Robert Atkins, what kind of nutrient will 'make you fat'. Carbs

A4.text: The Atkins diet is promoted with claims that carbohydrate restriction is the 'key' to weight loss.

A5.text: In the long term, low-carbohydrate diets do not appear to confer a 'metabolic advantage,' and effective weight loss or maintenance depends on the level of calorie restriction, not the ratio of macronutrients in a diet.

A6.text: The Endocrine Society says that body-fat accumulation does not appear to be affected by even very pronounced changes in the amount of fat vs carbohydrate in the diet when calorie intake is constant.
